text.div: Social Skills Training Care Plan
Dan Veteran
Social Skills Training

action.description: Provided overview of SST and confirmed appropriateness for SST
Discussed relationship of social skills to goals
Assessed / problem-solved barriers and facilitators to intervention or progress
Discussed rationale and steps of social skill
Modeled skill; reviewed model with members
Had group members role play skill with personalized scenarios  a minimum of 3 times each
Elicited and provided positive feedback about the role-plays followed by constructive feedback. If no constructive feedback was provided, planned how to make next role-play more challenging.
Developed / Reviewed personalized outside practice assignments

meta.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
meta.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

ed.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
ed.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
ed.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this care plan by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
meta.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

ed.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this care plan by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
ed.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)).  It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types.  For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.
ed.requirements: Allows identification of the care plan as it is known by various participating systems and in a way that remains consistent across servers.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

ed.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.
meta.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

ed.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan.
ed.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

ed.definition: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.
ed.requirements: Allows tracing of the care plan and tracking whether proposals/recommendations were acted upon.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.
meta.comment: The replacement could be because the initial care plan was immediately rejected (due to an issue) or because the previous care plan was completed, but the need for the action described by the care plan remains ongoing.

ed.definition: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.
ed.comment: The replacement could be because the initial care plan was immediately rejected (due to an issue) or because the previous care plan was completed, but the need for the action described by the care plan remains ongoing.
ed.requirements: Allows tracing the continuation of a therapy or administrative process instantiated through multiple care plans.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.
meta.comment: Each care plan is an independent request, such that having a care plan be part of another care plan can cause issues with cascading statuses.  As such, this element is still being discussed.

ed.definition: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.
ed.comment: Each care plan is an independent request, such that having a care plan be part of another care plan can cause issues with cascading statuses.  As such, this element is still being discussed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.
meta.comment: The unknown code is not to be used to convey other statuses.  The unknown code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the care plan.  This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the plan as not currently valid.

ed.short: draft | active | on-hold | revoked | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
ed.definition: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.
ed.comment: The unknown code is not to be used to convey other statuses.  The unknown code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the care plan.  This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the plan as not currently valid.
ed.requirements: Allows clinicians to determine whether the plan is actionable or not.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

ed.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

mapping.map: .statusCode planned = new active = active completed = completed

meta.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the care plan and where the care plan fits into the workflow chain.
meta.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the intent alters when and how the resource is actually applicable.

ed.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the care plan and where the care plan fits into the workflow chain.
ed.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the intent alters when and how the resource is actually applicable.
ed.requirements: Proposals/recommendations, plans and orders all use the same structure and can exist in the same fulfillment chain.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

ed.isModifierReason: This element changes the interpretation of all descriptive attributes. For example "the time the request is recommended to occur" vs. "the time the request is authorized to occur" or "who is recommended to perform the request" vs. "who is authorized to perform the request"

binding.description: Codes indicating the degree of authority/intentionality associated with a care plan.

meta.definition: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", "wellness plan", etc.
meta.comment: There may be multiple axes of categorization and one plan may serve multiple purposes.  In some cases, this may be redundant with references to CarePlan.concern.

ed.definition: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", "wellness plan", etc.
ed.comment: There may be multiple axes of categorization and one plan may serve multiple purposes.  In some cases, this may be redundant with references to CarePlan.concern.
ed.requirements: Used for filtering what plan(s) are retrieved and displayed to different types of users.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", etc.

meta.definition: Human-friendly name for the care plan.

ed.short: Human-friendly name for the care plan
ed.definition: Human-friendly name for the care plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: A description of the scope and nature of the plan.

ed.definition: A description of the scope and nature of the plan.
ed.requirements: Provides more detail than conveyed by category.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is described by the plan.

ed.short: Who the care plan is for
ed.definition: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is described by the plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: The Encounter during which this CarePlan was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
meta.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter. CarePlan activities conducted as a result of the care plan may well occur as part of other encounters.

ed.definition: The Encounter during which this CarePlan was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
ed.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter. CarePlan activities conducted as a result of the care plan may well occur as part of other encounters.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.
meta.comment: Any activities scheduled as part of the plan should be constrained to the specified period regardless of whether the activities are planned within a single encounter/episode or across multiple encounters/episodes (e.g. the longitudinal management of a chronic condition).

ed.definition: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.
ed.comment: Any activities scheduled as part of the plan should be constrained to the specified period regardless of whether the activities are planned within a single encounter/episode or across multiple encounters/episodes (e.g. the longitudinal management of a chronic condition).
ed.requirements: Allows tracking what plan(s) are in effect at a particular time.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Represents when this particular CarePlan record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

ed.definition: Represents when this particular CarePlan record was created in the system, which is often a system-generated date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: When populated, the author is responsible for the care plan.  The care plan is attributed to the author.
meta.comment: The author may also be a contributor.  For example, an organization can be an author, but not listed as a contributor.

ed.short: Who is the designated responsible party
ed.definition: When populated, the author is responsible for the care plan.  The care plan is attributed to the author.
ed.comment: The author may also be a contributor.  For example, an organization can be an author, but not listed as a contributor.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies the individual(s) or organization who provided the contents of the care plan.
meta.comment: Collaborative care plans may have multiple contributors.

ed.short: Who provided the content of the care plan
ed.definition: Identifies the individual(s) or organization who provided the contents of the care plan.
ed.comment: Collaborative care plans may have multiple contributors.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.

ed.definition: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.
ed.requirements: Allows representation of care teams, helps scope care plan.  In some cases may be a determiner of access permissions.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: Request.performer {similar but does not entail CareTeam}

meta.definition: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.
meta.comment: When the diagnosis is related to an allergy or intolerance, the Condition and AllergyIntolerance resources can both be used. However, to be actionable for decision support, using Condition alone is not sufficient as the allergy or intolerance condition needs to be represented as an AllergyIntolerance.

ed.definition: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.
ed.comment: When the diagnosis is related to an allergy or intolerance, the Condition and AllergyIntolerance resources can both be used. However, to be actionable for decision support, using Condition alone is not sufficient as the allergy or intolerance condition needs to be represented as an AllergyIntolerance.
ed.requirements: Links plan to the conditions it manages.  The element can identify risks addressed by the plan as well as active conditions.  (The Condition resource can include things like "at risk for hypertension" or "fall risk".)  Also scopes plans - multiple plans may exist addressing different concerns.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include comorbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.
meta.comment: Use "concern" to identify specific conditions addressed by the care plan.

ed.short: Information considered as part of plan
ed.definition: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include comorbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.
ed.comment: Use "concern" to identify specific conditions addressed by the care plan.
ed.requirements: Identifies barriers and other considerations associated with the care plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.
meta.comment: Goal can be achieving a particular change or merely maintaining a current state or even slowing a decline.

ed.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.
ed.comment: Goal can be achieving a particular change or merely maintaining a current state or even slowing a decline.
ed.requirements: Provides context for plan.  Allows plan effectiveness to be evaluated by clinicians.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan.  For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.

ed.short: Action to occur as part of plan
ed.definition: Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan.  For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.
ed.requirements: Allows systems to prompt for performance of planned activities, and validate plans against best practice.

constraint.human: Provide a reference or detail, not both
All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: {no mapping NOTE: This is a list of contained Request-Event tuples!}

meta.definition: Identifies the outcome at the point when the status of the activity is assessed.  For example, the outcome of an education activity could be patient understands (or not).
meta.comment: Note that this should not duplicate the activity status (e.g. completed or in progress).

ed.definition: Identifies the outcome at the point when the status of the activity is assessed.  For example, the outcome of an education activity could be patient understands (or not).
ed.comment: Note that this should not duplicate the activity status (e.g. completed or in progress).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Identifies the results of the activity.

meta.definition: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity.  The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself.  The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a request resource).
meta.comment: The activity outcome is independent of the outcome of the related goal(s).  For example, if the goal is to achieve a target body weight of 150 lbs and an activity is defined to diet, then the activity outcome could be calories consumed whereas the goal outcome is an observation for the actual body weight measured.

ed.definition: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity.  The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself.  The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a request resource).
ed.comment: The activity outcome is independent of the outcome of the related goal(s).  For example, if the goal is to achieve a target body weight of 150 lbs and an activity is defined to diet, then the activity outcome could be calories consumed whereas the goal outcome is an observation for the actual body weight measured.
ed.requirements: Links plan to resulting actions.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: {Event that is outcome of Request in activity.reference}

meta.definition: Notes about the adherence/status/progress of the activity.
meta.comment: This element should NOT be used to describe the activity to be performed - that occurs either within the resource pointed to by activity.detail.reference or in activity.detail.description.

ed.definition: Notes about the adherence/status/progress of the activity.
ed.comment: This element should NOT be used to describe the activity to be performed - that occurs either within the resource pointed to by activity.detail.reference or in activity.detail.description.
ed.requirements: Can be used to capture information about adherence, progress, concerns, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.
meta.comment: Standard extension exists ([resource-pertainsToGoal](extension-resource-pertainstogoal.html)) that allows goals to be referenced from any of the referenced resources in CarePlan.activity.reference.   The goal should be visible when the resource referenced by CarePlan.activity.reference is viewed independently from the CarePlan.  Requests that are pointed to by a CarePlan using this element should *not* point to this CarePlan using the "basedOn" element.  i.e. Requests that are part of a CarePlan are not "based on" the CarePlan.

ed.short: Activity details defined in specific resource
ed.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.
ed.comment: Standard extension exists ([resource-pertainsToGoal](extension-resource-pertainstogoal.html)) that allows goals to be referenced from any of the referenced resources in CarePlan.activity.reference.   The goal should be visible when the resource referenced by CarePlan.activity.reference is viewed independently from the CarePlan.  Requests that are pointed to by a CarePlan using this element should *not* point to this CarePlan using the "basedOn" element.  i.e. Requests that are part of a CarePlan are not "based on" the CarePlan.
ed.requirements: Details in a form consistent with other applications and contexts of use.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: {Request that resulted in Event in activity.actionResulting}

meta.definition: A simple summary of a planned activity suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.

ed.definition: A simple summary of a planned activity suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.
ed.requirements: Details in a simple form for generic care plan systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: A description of the kind of resource the in-line definition of a care plan activity is representing.  The CarePlan.activity.detail is an in-line definition when a resource is not referenced using CarePlan.activity.reference.  For example, a MedicationRequest, a ServiceRequest, or a CommunicationRequest.

ed.short: Appointment | CommunicationRequest | DeviceRequest | MedicationRequest | NutritionOrder | Task | ServiceRequest | VisionPrescription
ed.definition: A description of the kind of resource the in-line definition of a care plan activity is representing.  The CarePlan.activity.detail is an in-line definition when a resource is not referenced using CarePlan.activity.reference.  For example, a MedicationRequest, a ServiceRequest, or a CommunicationRequest.
ed.requirements: May determine what types of extensions are permitted.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Resource types defined as part of FHIR that can be represented as in-line definitions of a care plan activity.

meta.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.

ed.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.
ed.requirements: Allows Questionnaires that the patient (or practitioner) should fill in to fulfill the care plan activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.
meta.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

ed.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, questionnaire or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this CarePlan activity.
ed.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.
ed.requirements: Allows Questionnaires that the patient (or practitioner) should fill in to fulfill the care plan activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Detailed description of the type of planned activity; e.g. what lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.
meta.comment: Tends to be less relevant for activities involving particular products.  Codes should not convey negation - use "prohibited" instead.

ed.definition: Detailed description of the type of planned activity; e.g. what lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.
ed.comment: Tends to be less relevant for activities involving particular products.  Codes should not convey negation - use "prohibited" instead.
ed.requirements: Allows matching performed to planned as well as validation against protocols.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Detailed description of the type of activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

meta.definition: Provides the rationale that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan or the reason why the activity was prohibited.
meta.comment: This could be a diagnosis code.  If a full condition record exists or additional detail is needed, use reasonCondition instead.

ed.short: Why activity should be done or why activity was prohibited
ed.definition: Provides the rationale that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan or the reason why the activity was prohibited.
ed.comment: This could be a diagnosis code.  If a full condition record exists or additional detail is needed, use reasonCondition instead.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Identifies why a care plan activity is needed.  Can include any health condition codes as well as such concepts as "general wellness", prophylaxis, surgical preparation, etc.

meta.definition: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.
meta.comment: Conditions can be identified at the activity level that are not identified as reasons for the overall plan.

ed.definition: Indicates another resource, such as the health condition(s), whose existence justifies this request and drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.
ed.comment: Conditions can be identified at the activity level that are not identified as reasons for the overall plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.

ed.definition: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.
ed.requirements: So that participants know the link explicitly.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.
meta.comment: Some aspects of status can be inferred based on the resources linked in actionTaken.  Note that "status" is only as current as the plan was most recently updated.   The unknown code is not to be used to convey other statuses.  The unknown code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the activity.

ed.short: not-started | scheduled | in-progress | on-hold | completed | cancelled | stopped | unknown | entered-in-error
ed.definition: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.
ed.comment: Some aspects of status can be inferred based on the resources linked in actionTaken.  Note that "status" is only as current as the plan was most recently updated.   The unknown code is not to be used to convey other statuses.  The unknown code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the activity.
ed.requirements: Indicates progress against the plan, whether the activity is still relevant for the plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

ed.isModifierReason: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the activity should not be treated as valid

binding.description: Codes that reflect the current state of a care plan activity within its overall life cycle.

mapping.map: .statusCode not-started = new scheduled = not-started (and fulfillment relationship to appointent) in-progress = active on-hold = suspended completed = completed cancelled = aborted

meta.definition: Provides reason why the activity isn't yet started, is on hold, was cancelled, etc.
meta.comment: Will generally not be present if status is "complete".  Be sure to prompt to update this (or at least remove the existing value) if the status is changed.

ed.definition: Provides reason why the activity isn't yet started, is on hold, was cancelled, etc.
ed.comment: Will generally not be present if status is "complete".  Be sure to prompt to update this (or at least remove the existing value) if the status is changed.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan.  If false, or missing, indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.
meta.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it marks an activity as an activity that is not to be performed.

ed.short: If true, activity is prohibiting action
ed.definition: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan.  If false, or missing, indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.
ed.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it marks an activity as an activity that is not to be performed.
ed.requirements: Captures intention to not do something that may have been previously typical.
ed.meaningWhenMissing: If missing indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

ed.isModifierReason: If true this element negates the specified action. For example, instead of a request for a procedure, it is a request for the procedure to not occur.

meta.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

ed.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.
ed.requirements: Allows prompting for activities and detection of missed planned activities.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.
meta.comment: May reference a specific clinical location or may identify a type of location.

ed.definition: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.
ed.comment: May reference a specific clinical location or may identify a type of location.
ed.requirements: Helps in planning of activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.
meta.comment: A performer MAY also be a participant in the care plan.

ed.definition: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.
ed.comment: A performer MAY also be a participant in the care plan.
ed.requirements: Helps in planning of activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (provider participations)); PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (non-provider person participations )) ; PRT-5 : ( PRV-4 = (patient non-subject of care) ) ; PRT-8

meta.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

ed.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: A product supplied or administered as part of a care plan activity.

meta.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day.

ed.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day.
ed.requirements: Allows rough dose checking.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied, administered or consumed by the subject.

ed.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied, administered or consumed by the subject.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: RXO-11 / RXE-10 / RXD-4 / RXG-5 / RXA-6 /  TQ1-2.1  *and*  RXO-12 /  RXE-11 / RXD-5 / RXG-7 / RXA-7 / TQ1-2.2

meta.definition: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities.  It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions.  Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc.

ed.short: Extra info describing activity to perform
ed.definition: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities.  It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions.  Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

meta.definition: General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.

ed.definition: General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.
ed.requirements: Used to capture information that applies to the plan as a whole that doesn't fit into discrete elements.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
